title: Public Testimony Flow
author: CivHub
description: A structured process for collecting and integrating public testimony into legislative decision-making.

steps.label: Step 1
steps.description: Public announcement of upcoming hearings and agenda.

steps.label: Step 2
steps.description: Online or in-person signup for testimony slots.

steps.label: Step 3
steps.description: Facilitated testimony sessions, with time limits enforced.

steps.label: Step 4
steps.description: Real-time transcription and recording of testimonies.

steps.label: Step 5
steps.description: Synthesis and reporting by committee staff.

recommended_tools: Zoom or other video conferencing software

title: Citizens' Assembly Protocol
author: CivHub
description: A framework for convening diverse groups of citizens to deliberate on policy questions and generate recommendations.

steps.label: Step 1
steps.description: Random selection of a representative group of citizens.

steps.label: Step 2
steps.description: Neutral presentation of background information.

steps.label: Step 3
steps.description: Facilitated small-group deliberations.

steps.label: Step 4
steps.description: Whole-group consensus sessions.

steps.label: Step 5
steps.description: Delivery of findings to policymakers.

title: Participatory Budgeting – Simple Tier
author: CivHub
description: A basic participatory budgeting model where community members decide how to allocate a portion of public funds.

steps.label: Step 1
steps.description: Announcement of available funds and timeline.

steps.label: Step 2
steps.description: Proposal collection from community members.

steps.label: Step 3
steps.description: Review and feasibility assessment of proposals.

steps.label: Step 4
steps.description: Community voting on eligible proposals.

steps.label: Step 5
steps.description: Implementation and public reporting.

title: Quadratic Voting
author: CivHub
description: A voting method that lets participants express how strongly they feel about an issue by casting multiple votes at quadratic cost.

steps.label: Step 1
steps.description: Each participant receives a budget of voting credits.

steps.label: Step 2
steps.description: Issues or proposals are presented for voting.

steps.label: Step 3
steps.description: Participants allocate votes to each option based on preference intensity.

steps.label: Step 4
steps.description: Vote costs increase quadratically: 1 vote = 1 credit, 2 votes = 4 credits, etc.

steps.label: Step 5
steps.description: Results are tallied and published.
